alert.note: Alert for Delta (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 2:56PM EDT until May 11 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Recent rainfall has resulted in high water levels along the Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Delta. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nahma and Nahma Junction. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report observed flooding to the National Weather Service in Marquette and local emergency services when you can do so safely.
